title: Roger Federer Cheers for Carlos Alcaraz at the Australian Open
summary: Roger Federer, a famous tennis player, is cheering for Carlos Alcaraz, a young tennis star, to win the Australian Open. If Alcaraz wins, he will become the youngest man to win all four major tennis tournaments, called the career Grand Slam. Federer knows this is hard because he did it too. Alcaraz is 22 years old and has already won Wimbledon, the French Open, and the US Open. He is number one in the world and has a big rivalry with Jannik Sinner, another top player. Federer hopes Alcaraz stays healthy and does well. Federer is in Melbourne for a special event to honor his career.

background_read: Tennis is a sport where players hit a ball over a net. There are four big tournaments called Grand Slams: Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, and US Open. Winning all four is called a career Grand Slam. Roger Federer is a legend who did this, and now Carlos Alcaraz, a young star, is trying to do it too at the Australian Open in Melbourne.
